summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, setting a firm trial date of November 29, 2021, and establishing a schedule for jury selection procedures, including a juror questionnaire, voir dire, and pretrial conferences.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this order is issued, setting her trial schedule.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this order, setting the trial date and procedural schedule.

events.title: Trial Commencement
events.description: The jury trial in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to commence.

events.title: Telephone Conference on Jury Selection
events.description: The parties are ordered to appear for a telephone conference to discuss jury selection matters.

events.title: In-Person Pretrial Conference
events.description: The parties are ordered to appear for an in-person pretrial conference.

events.title: Juror Questionnaire Administration
events.description: Dates provided by the Clerk's Office for administering a juror questionnaire (November 4, 5, and 12).

events.title: Voir Dire
events.description: Dates provided by the Clerk's Office for conducting voir dire (November 16-19).

events.title: Court Informs Parties of Tentative Trial Date
events.description: The Court informed the parties it set a tentative trial date for November 29, 2021.

events.title: Court Sets Schedule
events.description: The Court set a schedule on this date, which is amended by the current order.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: A firm trial date for Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal case was set for November 29, 2021.
The order establishes a detailed schedule for jury selection, including deadlines for submitting a joint juror questionnaire, proposed voir dire, motions in limine, and a joint proposed charge.
The order references COVID-19 protocols in the SDNY that create space limitations, affecting the scheduling of juror questionnaires and voir dire.
The document is a formal court order (Document 330) filed on August 27, 2021, in case 20-CR-330.
Judge Alison J. Nathan is presiding over the case and issued the scheduling order.
